p: In Antarctica, AIVs were detected only serologically (in penguins [ 46]), but the Antarctic cryosphere should not be excluded as having, to a certain degree, a cryobiological role which is similar to the northern cryosphere, regarding the ecology of IAV. Antarctica, albeit the paucity of waterfowl found in it (only the southern pintail Anas eatoni and speckled teal A. flavirostris), is frequented by multiple seabirds—part of which hosts AIVs, potentially—and comprises (in difference of the Arctic Ocean) a huge land with many freezing-thawing freshwater bodies. Also, an interface between holarctic and antarctic aquatic birds exists and presumably introduces multiple AIVs into southern avifaunas. The arctic tern ( Sterna paradisaea), a species known to host AIVs and migrate from pole to pole [ 47], conspicuously illustrates this apparatus.
